meanings.definition: In a sad or dejected manner
meanings.sent1: She walked mopishly home after receiving the bad news.
meanings.sent2: He looked mopishly out the window on the rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The puppy stared mopishly at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The old tree swayed mopishly in the gentle breeze, as if mourning its lost leaves.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood mopishly on the corner, a shadow of its former self.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of energy or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: The cat lay mopishly on the couch, uninterested in playing.
meanings.sent2: She gave a mopishly half-hearted smile when asked about her day.
meanings.sent3: The car sputtered mopishly down the road, in need of a tune-up.
meanings.sent4: The clock ticked mopishly on the wall, as if tired of counting time.
meanings.sent5: The student sat mopishly at the back of the class, barely participating in the discussion.
